hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout in Mid-Cap Narrative Assets
hypothesis_content.statement: During extended NEUTRAL regimes with suppressed volatility, a simultaneous compression in BTC 10-day realized volatility (<30%) and a surge in social volume for a specific narrative (e.g., 'AI agents', 'Real World Assets') will precede a sharp, liquidity-driven breakout in related mid-cap assets (e.g., GRT for AI, TRUMP for politics).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volatility traps liquidity on the sidelines. A concentrated surge in narrative attention acts as a catalyst, funneling that pent-up liquidity into a small set of identifiable assets, creating a powerful but short-lived momentum move.
entry_conditions: Social dominance score for a specific narrative (AI, RWA, Gaming) spikes to 90th percentile of 60-day range
The leading mid-cap asset for that narrative (e.g., GRT) shows a 5-day positive funding rate in perpetual swaps

exit_conditions.take_profit: Asset price hits 1.5x its 20-day Average True Range (ATR) measured from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price falls below the low of the consolidation range preceding entry
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days after entry if no breakout occurs

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Narrative social volume spikes and volatility is low, but the identified mid-cap asset fails to break out of its recent range (as defined by ATR) within 3 days.
